name: Mark Brozier Cartwright
content: MARK CARTWRIGHT Assistant ProfessorNew Jersey Institute of Technology Follow Brooklyn, NY Google Scholar LinkedIn Twitter GitHub Email My research lies at the intersection of human-computer interaction, machine learning, and audio signal processing. Specifically, I research human-centered machine listening and audio processing tools for understanding and creating sound. I am an Assistant Professor at New Jersey Institute of Technology in the Department of Informatics and the head of the Sound Interaction and Computing (SInC) Lab. I completed my PhD in computer science at Northwestern University as a member of the Interactive Audio Lab, and I hold a Master of Arts from Stanford University (CCRMA) and a Bachelor of Music from Northwestern University. Before my current position, I spent four years as a researcher in the Music and Audio Research Lab (MARL) and the Center for Urban Science and Progress (CUSP) at New York University (NYU). Current Affiliations Sound Interaction and Computing (SInC) Lab NJIT Department of Informatics NJIT Department of Computer Science NJIT Center for AI Research NYU Music and Audio Research Laboratory (MARL) PhD Advisees Keita Ohshiro Sripathi Sridhar Contact New Jersey Institute of Technology GITC, Room 3902E University Heights, Newark, New Jersey 07102
